newsitem.title: UK: BBA higher as first half results please.
newsitem.headline: BBA higher as first half results please.

text.p: Shares in international engineering company BBA Group Plc moved ahead on Wednesday after a 19 percent rise in first half profits, the top end of market expectations, analysts said.
Pre-tax profits rose to 72.1 million stg before exceptionals. The dividend was raised 17 percent to 2.1 pence.
"The results were at the upper end of forecasts. Cash flow was also very strong in the first half -- much stronger than most people had anticipated," said SG Strauss Turnbull analyst Andy Chambers.
Ongoing cash flows plus the ability to gear up would be used for bolt-on acquistions, BBA said.
"If an opportunity arises they'll look for another leg but the bolt-ons are the priority in the short-term," said Chambers.

The company said transportation's friction unit had enjoyed a good period in the face of tough market conditions in Germany and an investment programme is expected to result in reduced costs and improved productivity later in the year.
"Germany is going to be pretty slow second half for friction materials primarily because the heavy commercial vehicle market there is still fairly flat," said Chambers.
"They do, however, have the benefit of the investment programme, which should improve efficiency," said Chambers.

Strong growth was coming through from the industrial businesses, mainly the non-woven business and Ajax, the induction heating business, and the electrical distributions and aerospace component businesses had not performed badly, he said.
Non-woven products performed in line with forecasts, with operating margins and market shares improving.
The filtration business is seen affording more growth potential this year and sound sales and easing of raw material costs pointed to encouraging prospects ahead, said BBA.
